references.reason: This is a foundational paper in network flow theory, introducing the max-flow min-cut theorem which underpins many modern algorithms including Push-Relabel.

references.paper_title: A new approach to the maximum-flow problem
references.reason: This paper introduced the Push-Relabel algorithm, which is the focus of the current paper, making it a crucial foundational reference.

references.paper_title: Interactive graph cuts for optimal boundary & region segmentation of objects in nd images
references.reason: This paper establishes the use of graph cuts in image segmentation, a key application area for the improved Push-Relabel algorithm presented in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Graph cuts and efficient nd image segmentation
references.reason: This further cemented the use of graph cuts for image segmentation, providing additional context for the application of the improved algorithm.
This highly relevant recent paper explored similar concepts of warm-starting flow algorithms, providing a direct comparison and contrast to the work presented in the current paper.
